lexUnit.name: diminish.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move lower on a scale

sentence.text: Not only do numbers diminish with distance , but it can be shown that there is a statistical over-selection of spouses who live close and corresponding under-selection of those who live far away .
Monk seal numbers diminish as conservationists argue
Her manipulation of royal power did not diminish as the Queen Mother grew into old age .
` Quite simply her bargaining power has diminished . "
This is evident when there is a preponderance of leaf growth in the centre of the clump and flower size diminishes .
Although the protests continued into June , their size diminished .
Unit Trusts are open-ended , which means that their size can grow or diminish according to the demand for units .
The accuracy of the feedback need not be greater than the discrimination ability of the trainee but equally its value will diminish if it is too approximate .
These office buildings are maintained in such condition that their value does not diminish and the cost of maintenance is charged to operating profit .

Nevertheless , over the past 30 years statutory regulation has diminished somewhat in importance in France and collective bargaining has developed considerably , doing much more than filling the gaps left by legislation .

In fact Trieste , which under the Austro-Hungarian Empire had been the main port of Middle Europe , had diminished in importance as far as Italy was concerned : Genoa had effectively taken its place .
Hence without the existence of heterodoxy and orthodoxy , collective struggles diminish greatly in importance in traditional societies .
Although diminishing in number , prerogative powers clearly remain of great importance .
All our coinage , even our notes , diminish in size in proportion to what you can buy with it .

Having argued that criticism of the trade surplus in Washington is misconceived , MITI 's forthcoming paper goes on to predict that the surplus will , of its own accord , gradually diminish in size and relevance :
The first is that the risk of insolvency diminishes with increased size .
At once the image shrank , diminishing to its former size .
In the failing light with the wind increasing , the visibility was diminishing rapidly .
With effort , vast at first , diminishing by slow degrees , she suppressed her body 's compulsions .
( Rich 1986 , p. 189 ) The rapid growth of job opportunities had considerably diminished by 1960 , but immigration was still increasing .

The number of meetings of MCC , for example , had diminished by half , its published responsibilities had altered , and even its relationship to MMRC in the Staff Guide management system flowchart had altered .
The very centre of the Mitte was most fully “ cleaned out ” — the population of Alt-Berlin diminished from 32,000 to 9,000 from 1871 to 1913 ; the population of Alt-Cölln from 16,500 to 6,200 .
No sooner has one cycle started to diminish in amplitude than another disturbance to the economy occurs , starting off a new cycle .
By contrast , self-regard is not usually diminished in normal grieving .
Yet these feelings seem to diminish in intensity as one gets older .
Does that indicate that the load has diminished in parallel ?
The crying diminished to a monotonous weary complaining level .
Nationally , the urban sulphur dioxide problem has diminished to the point where only a small number of urban sites now exceed the air quality standard .
Concurrently the calibre of MPs would diminish with each new intake .
The prevalence of this diminishes with time after the event , which you might think peculiar , but there are fewer patients who have been followed up for five years .
Social services have now diminished even further because of the war and the crisis since 1979 .
The purchase grant for 1992 diminishes to Pta300 million ( £1.6 million ) .
Then , for a decade or so , its effects diminished considerably .
If the vacuum gap diminishes slightly , as it does when the tip approaches a bump on the surface , the current increases .
I shall have to write in small letters as my pile of paper has considerably diminished , but write it I must .
